pr_title: Support Curator Service Discovery and Spring Cloud ZooKeeper

timeline.message:
Support Curator-X-Discovery and Spring Cloud ZooKeeper
Motivation:
Related #2673.
It will be nice if we support Curator-X-Discovery and Spring Cloud Zookeeper.

Modifications:
- Add `InstanceSpec` and `DiscoverySpec` to specify whether use default format or Curator compatible format.
- (Breaking)
  - `NodeValueCodec` is gone.
    - You now have to use `InstanceSpec` and `DiscoverySpec` to encode and decode.
    - `ZooKeeperEndpointGroupBuilder.codec(...)` and `ZooKeeperUpatingListenerBuilder.codec(...)` are gone as well.

Result:
- You can now use Armeria client and server with Curator-X-Discovery.

timeline.bodyText: ? super ServiceInstance<?> ?
timeline.author: trustin

replies.bodyText: Let's use legacy because I think we should guide people to use curator x which is a de-facto standard. 😉
replies.author: minwoox

timeline.bodyText: If we chose to use legacy instead of default, we're gonna have to always require a DiscoverySpec.

timeline.bodyText: ssl or tls?
timeline.author: trustin

replies.bodyText:
The word ssl is used by the Curator so I followed it.
Isn't it better to use the word what they are using?
For the Eureka we used secure port. 🤔
replies.author: minwoox

timeline.bodyText: Should we log this or not?
timeline.author: trustin

replies.bodyText:
The user specified a certain port but the server does not open that port.
So I think I should warn.
Perhaps, it's better to rephrase the sentence?
replies.author: minwoox

timeline.bodyText:
How about just CuratorDiscoverySpec(Builder)? Because:

X seems to be an acronym for 'extra' or 'extension' (e.g. curator-x-async)
Curator implies Zookeeper anyway.

timeline.bodyText:
This try-catch block will also catch an IllegalArgumentException that occurred when a path contains /.
The concatenated error message will have duplicate name: path.
name: path (reason: name cannot have /. name: path)
Could we catch only PathUtils.validatePath()?
